snippet.title: Characterization of Densin-180, a New Brain-Specific Synaptic Protein of the O-Sialoglycoprotein Family
snippet.description:
* Characterization of Densin-180, a New Brain-Specific Synaptic Protein of the O-Sialoglycoprotein Family (Citations: 48)
Michelle L. Apperson, Mary B. Kennedy
We purified an abundant protein of apparent molecular mass 180 kDa from the postsynaptic density fraction of rat forebrain and obtained amino acid sequences of three tryptic peptides generated from the protein. The sequences were used to de- sign a strategy for cloning the cDNA encoding the protein by polymerase chain reaction. The open reading frame of the cDNA encodes ...
Published in 1996.

snippet.title: Several new substrates for Desulfovibrio vulgaris strain Marburg and a spontaneous mutant from it
snippet.description:
* Several new substrates for Desulfovibrio vulgaris strain Marburg and a spontaneous mutant from it (Citations: 3)
Kazuhiro Tanaka
The ability of Desulfovibrio vulgaris strain Marburg (DSM 2119) to oxidize alcohols was surveyed in the presence and absence of hydrogen-scavenging anaerobes, Acetobacterium woodii and Methanospirillum hungatei. In the presence of sulfate, D. vulgaris grew not only on ethanol, 1-propanol, and 1-butanol, but also on isobutanol, 1-pentanol, ethyleneglycol, and 1,3-propanediol. Metabolism of these alcohols ...
Journal: Archives of Microbiology - ARCH MICROBIOL , vol. 155, no. 1, pp. 18-21, 1990
